meanings.definition: Act in such a way as to have an effect on another.
meanings.sent1: Children can interact with each other by playing games together.
meanings.sent2: In a team project, it is important for all members to interact effectively.
meanings.sent3: The toys seemed to interact magically, moving on their own.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to interact with his emotions, causing a visible reaction.
meanings.sent5: The colors on the canvas interacted in a beautiful dance of hues.

meanings.sent1: Students can interact with their classmates during group discussions.
meanings.sent2: In a successful business, different departments need to interact seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the zoo seemed to interact like old friends.
meanings.sent4: The music and lyrics interacted perfectly, creating a moving song.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish interacted harmoniously, creating a delicious taste.
